title: Ahmed Awad Ibn Auf - Wikipedia
snippet: Ahmed Awad Ibn Auf (born c. 1956; Arabic: أحمد عوض بن عوف‎) is a Sudanese military officer and politician who served as the de facto head of state for one day from 11 April 2019 to 12 April 2019 after taking part in the 2019 Sudanese coup d'état.

title: Profile: How Ibn Auf went from regime insider to new Sudan ruler | Arab News
snippet: CAIRO: Sudanese General Ahmed Awad Ibn Auf, who led the overthrow of veteran leader Omar Al-Bashir and has emerged as the country’s new ruler, is already under US sanctions for his alleged role in the brutal Darfur conflict.

title: Ahmed Awad Ibn Auf | Historica Wiki | Fandom
snippet: Ahmed Awad Ibn Auf (1957-) was ... Ibn Auf was born in 1957, and he served as Head of Military Intelligence and as Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff of the Sudanese military....

title: Ahmed Awad Ibn Auf | Military Wiki | Fandom
snippet: Ahmed Awad Ibn Auf (born c. 1956;[4] Arabic language: أحمد عوض بن عوف‎‎) is a Sudanese politician and Sudanese Army General who served as the de facto head of state for one day[5] from 11 April 2019 to 12 April 2019 after taking ...

title: Sudanese General Ahmed Awad Ibn Auf | Al Majalla
snippet: 1 - Born in 1957, Ahmed Awad Ibn Auf is a career military man who took over the country for just 24 hours on 11 April following the protests that ended President Omar al-Bashir’s 30-year reign.
